meanings.definition: Capable of being undone or voided.
meanings.sent1: The contract was defeasible, meaning it could be canceled if certain conditions were not met.
meanings.sent2: The warranty was defeasible, allowing for a refund if the product did not work as promised.
meanings.sent3: The magician's spell was defeasible, disappearing when the clock struck midnight.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was defeasible, fading away as soon as he mentioned the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The sandcastle was defeasible, easily washed away by the incoming tide.

meanings.definition: Subject to being annulled or made void.
meanings.sent1: The parking permit was defeasible, expiring at the end of the month.
meanings.sent2: The offer was defeasible, open to cancellation if not accepted within the specified time frame.
meanings.sent3: The student's excuse was defeasible, falling apart under the teacher's scrutiny.
meanings.sent4: His confidence was defeasible, shattered by the harsh criticism.
meanings.sent5: The ice sculpture was defeasible, melting under the hot sun.
